issue.title: GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX

content.raw: I wanted to show a robot to my daughter, but my laptop wouldn't load it properly because of this bug!
content.html: I wanted to show a robot to my daughter, but my laptop wouldn't load it properly because of this bug!

issue.title: GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX
GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX

content.html:
I was just looking at this recently in ignition-common, since this code has been migrated there, and I think there is something weird about the memory access in the TriangleIsHole function. I added some print statements to the code, which fixes the test:

diff -r 4696c8d7d7ed src/GTSMeshUtils.cc
--- a/src/GTSMeshUtils.cc   Fri Sep 08 00:11:40 2017 +0000
+++ b/src/GTSMeshUtils.cc   Mon Sep 11 16:17:03 2017 -0700
@@ -116,10 +116,21 @@

   gts_fifo_foreach(_edgeList, (GtsFunc) Intersection, data);

+  std::cerr << "x y intersections: "
+            << xCenter << " "
+            << yCenter << " "
+            << intersections << " "
+            << intersections % 2 << std::endl;
   if (intersections % 2)
     return false;
   else
+  {
+    std::cerr << "v1 " << v1->p.x << " " << v1->p.y << ",  "
+              << "v2 " << v2->p.x << " " << v2->p.y << ",  "
+              << "v3 " << v3->p.x << " " << v3->p.y
+              << std::endl;
     return true;
+  }
 }

 //////////////////////////////////////////////////

Maybe int intersections variable is being changed at compile time as an optimization? I tried making it volatile but clang complained about that.

issue.title: GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX

content.html:
Actually with just one of the comments, I get a seg-fault on osx at GTSMeshUtils.cc:72 but only without running through lldb.

diff -r 4696c8d7d7ed src/GTSMeshUtils.cc
--- a/src/GTSMeshUtils.cc   Fri Sep 08 00:11:40 2017 +0000
+++ b/src/GTSMeshUtils.cc   Mon Sep 11 16:17:03 2017 -0700
@@ -116,10 +116,21 @@

   gts_fifo_foreach(_edgeList, (GtsFunc) Intersection, data);

+  //std::cerr << "x y intersections: "
+  //          << xCenter << " "
+  //          << yCenter << " "
+  //          << intersections << " "
+  //          << intersections % 2 << std::endl;
   if (intersections % 2)
     return false;
   else
+  {
+    std::cerr << "v1 " << v1->p.x << " " << v1->p.y << ",  "
+              << "v2 " << v2->p.x << " " << v2->p.y << ",  "
+              << "v3 " << v3->p.x << " " << v3->p.y
+              << std::endl;
     return true;
+  }
 }

 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
